title.rendered: There are many types of car accident injuries

content.rendered:
The worst part of being involved in a car accident is the potential to suffer a serious injury. While you hope to avoid this, you never know what will happen if you are in a crash.

Here’s the most important thing to remember: You need to receive immediate medical attention after a car accident. This may not be something you want to do, but it’s best from a health and safety perspective.

Here are some of the more common types of car accident injuries:

  • Head and back injuries. This includes everything from a concussion to a herniated disk. Some of these injuries don’t present symptoms right away, but you still need to seek medical treatment.
  • Neck and chest injuries. Neck injuries are extremely common in motor vehicle accidents, especially one in which your car is struck from behind. It’s not out of the question to suffer a serious injury, such as a broken neck, which can lead to paralysis.
  • Broken bones. Any bone in your body can break in the event of a car accident. From your neck to your arms to your legs, you need to realize that this type of injury can occur.
  • Ligament damage. The impact of a crash can lead to a variety of ligament injuries, such as a torn ACL.

If you are part of a car accident, you hope that you don’t suffer any type of injury. However, you know that this could happen.

The best thing you can do is move your car to safety and call 911. This will ensure that an ambulance arrives at the scene to provide immediate treatment.

Once you know your injuries and treatment strategy, you can then turn your attention to your legal rights. You may be able to seek compensation from a negligent driver.
